−
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "arising from habit"), a major branch of [[philosophy]], is the study of [[value]] or quality. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of the concept of ethics), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how to determine ethical values), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical values).
+
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "arising from habit"), a major branch of [[philosophy]], is the study of [[value]], or [[morals]] and [[morality]]. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of the concept of ethics), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how to determine ethical values), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical values).
 
ethics is the un-written law for the people to follow.
 
ethics is the un-written law for the people to follow.
